subject: Re: [junit] SecurityException: Prohibited package name
msgSnippet: ... I hate to be rude, but do you /understand/ the error message? Java does not allow you to use the package java.beans. Are you trying to put your own classes
messageBody:
reykish wrote:

> Any clue on this.
>
> 1.I get a "Prohibited package name: java.beans" Exception when I run a
> test.

I hate to be rude, but do you /understand/ the error message? Java does
not allow you to use the package java.beans. Are you trying to put your
own classes into that package?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
